title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk - BBC News
summary: jail term for man who kidnapped nine-year-old girl .
health centre evacuated after being hit by car .
norwich city hoping for fa cup double .

documents.title: norwich city 2-2 southampton
text: norwich city 2-2 southampton

documents.title: our live coverage today
text: that 's all from the norfolk live team for today - and for the week .
here 's a quick recap of some of the stories we 've brought you today :
after a cold and cloudy day , we 'll leave you with this bright and cheery of a robin , snapped by weather watcher alistair , with not a cloud in the sky .
join us again on monday , at 08:00 - have a good weekend .

documents.title: court appearance for man charged with firearms offences
text: a man has appeared before norwich magistrates ' court on firearms charges .

michael cook , of holmesdale road , brundall , was charged with two counts of possessing a prohibited weapon , two counts relating to firearms and shotgun certificate offences , and two counts of possessing ammunition .
the weapons were found during a search of the property by police in may 2016 .
mr cook , 62 , did n't enter a plea .
he 's due to appear at norwich crown court on 3 february .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new wildlife charity for north norfolk
text: a new wildlife conservation charity is being launched in north norfolk to help protect species under threat on the coast and heathlands .
the felbeck trust will be managing sites around the villages of aylmerton , sustead and felbrigg , restoring and managing wildlife habitats .
the trust , which promotes the use of traditional skills and materials , will work in partnership with other norfolk voluntary groups .
trevor williams , chairman of the charity , said it would complement the work of the big conservation organisations , not be in competition .
`` birds , mammals and insects have pockets of protected land that they can find and use which will connect to the bigger reserves , '' he said .
if successful , the trust would be keen to expand locations , initially in north norfolk .
`` the key is to engage in the communities where the small pockets of land lie and get their interest , '' mr williams said .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: some illuminating facts about cromer 's fireworks
text: cromer 's annual fireworks display , which will go ahead on sunday after being cancelled on new year 's eve , was set up in 2000 as a way of marking the new millennium .
after outgrowing its display in a local park , the event moved to the town 's iconic pier and thousands are expected this sunday for the rescheduled show .
here are some sparkling facts about this year 's dazzling 13-minute display :
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: overnight weather : feeling a tad warmer , with outbreaks of mainly patchy rain
text: it will be a cloudy , misty evening and night with outbreaks of generally light , patchy rain .
less cold air moving in behind the rain , so temperatures not dropping as low overnight .
minimum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .
tomorrow rain will clear eastwards , but it 'll remain rather cloudy and rather gloomy .
top temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
get the full forecast where you live , from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: alex neil to change team for the cup
text: norwich city will make changes to their starting line-up for the fa cup tie against premier league club southampton tomorrow .
alex neil admitted that his focus was fully on the championship and changes would have to be made to protect important players .
the canaries will be without robbie brady ( suspended ) and graham dorrans ( knee injury ) .
norwich return to league action the following week when they travel to rotherham .
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: 'pillar of the diss community ' reverend ben sasada dies
text: well-known diss community stalwart , reverend ben sasada , has died .
he was 83 .
author: Diss Express

documents.title: 'business as usual ' at car-damaged health centre
text: staff at a health centre near king 's lynn had a lucky escape earlier this afternoon , after a vehicle went into the side of the building .
ana weston , practice manager at the gayton road health centre , said : `` suddenly there was a huge bang , a lot of dust and debris flying about .
fortunately it was in an area of the office where there are cupboards .
`` the team were shocked and frozen in place .
then they realised a car had gone into the side of the building .
`` it 's about halfway in , the rear of the car is parked in our office .
there were some staff in the vicinity but they were n't directly working against the wall .
although they were in a state of shock they carried on and kept the service going .
`` i ca n't comment on the driver , but everybody involved has been uninjured by the incident .
there were no physical injuries , we 've been very fortunate indeed . ''
ms weston said surveyors were `` confident '' the building would be ok , and the car would be removed shortly .
she said it was business as usual for patients with appointments .

documents.title: photos : car embedded in health centre
text: thanks to maria symonds for sending us these photographs showing the car embedded in the wall of gayton road health centre , in gaywood near king 's lynn .

documents.title: railway station evacuated
text: norwich railway station was evacuated after the fire alarm sounded a short while ago .
greater anglia spokeswoman lucy wright told me that passengers waited outside the building for 10 minutes , but were allowed back in after there was found to be no sign of any fire .
there will be some delays to train services .

documents.title: assault victim in hospital
text: a man is in hospital after being assaulted in great yarmouth last night .
the victim , in his 20s and from the local area , received a puncture wound to his chest and is in a serious , but stable condition , in papworth hospital , cambridgeshire .
the incident is believed to have taken place in the havelock road area , near to the red herring pub , at around 20:30 to 20:45 .
police are carrying out inquiries to establish the circumstances behind the assault , and are appealing for anyone with information to contact them .

documents.title: surgery evacuated after being hit by car
text: a doctors ' surgery in west norfolk has been evacuated after being hit by a car .
the vehicle hit the gayton road health centre , in gaywood near king 's lynn , at around 13:20 .
it 's understood the car is completely inside the building , which had to be evacuated by emergency services .
it 's thought that no-one was hurt .
eight fire crews have been at the scene , and a specialist fire and rescue team is on its way to secure the building .
author: Jo Thewlis
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: nelson is a top class operator
text: in-form striker looks the real deal for city - the back page of the norwich evening news today :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: tribute to man who died in blaze
text: the front page of today 's norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: mental health issues 'not funded '
text: the former care minister , norman lamb , says people with mental health problems are being discriminated against .
the north norfolk mp says there 's a shortage of community psychiatric nurses , detox facilities and a shortage in social care which has hit people with mental health issues .
`` people with mental ill health do n't have the same right to get treatment on a timely basis as others enjoy , '' he said .

`` when i was minister i introduced the first ever maximum waiting time standards but the government is n't funding it it 's always mental health that loses out more than other parts of the system . ''
nhs england data has shown a 56 % rise in the number of bed days lost to delayed discharge in psychiatric trusts in october 2016 , compared to november 2015 .
the problem is being blamed on a shortage of social care packages , but the government says it has a five year , £ 400m plan to transform mental health services .

documents.title: school remains closed until monday
text: it 's a long weekend for pupils of methwold primary .
the school closed yesterday because of a broken boiler , and remains closed today .
the school is expected to reopen on monday .
and in north norfolk , sidestrand hall school also has no heating .
the school will be closing while they wait for a part to be delivered .

documents.title: win your way to the fa cup final # peoplescup
text: sign up to the fa people 's cup and you could win your way on to the hallowed wembley stadium turf at half-time during the fa cup final .
entries are now open and you can find out all the details here .

documents.title: photo : man jailed for kidnap
text: norfolk police has released a photo of paul barton , who 's been jailed for the kidnap of a young girl in a norwich park last year .
at norwich crown court this morning , barton , 33 , was sentenced to three years in prison and given a 10 year sexual harm prevention order .
he admitted grabbing the nine-year-old girl at a park in norwich and dragging her into woodland in september .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cloud increasing , with outbreaks of rain
text: after a cold and frosty morning , it 'll become cloudy with outbreaks of rain later this afternoon .
temperatures reaching a high of 5c ( 41f ) .

documents.title: new year 's day fireworks display planned for sunday
text: here 's a chance to get back to the future with a new year 's day fireworks display in cromer .
adverse weather meant last weekend 's event had to be cancelled , with fears that winds could blow debris into crowds along the promenade and beach front .
but it 's now been given the go-ahead for sunday .
organisers will be setting up the fireworks along the pier and promenade from 10:00 , for a `` firing '' time of 17:00 .
the free show , which has taken place every year since 2000 , regularly attracts more than 10,000 people .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man who kidnapped girl , 9 , given prison sentence
text: a man has been sentenced to jail after pleading guilty to the kidnap of a nine-year-old girl at a park in norwich .
paul barton , of no fixed abode , admitted grabbing the girl in pointers field , off george pope road , on 30 september .
he dragged her into a wooded area before she managed to escape unharmed .
barton , 33 , has been sentenced to three years in prison , and must serve at least half before release .
author: Tom Baker
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: action needed 'to secure future of nhs ' , says mp
text: the liberal democrat health spokesman norman lamb says hospitals are facing unprecedented pressure this winter , with cancelled operations , bed shortages and patients being turned away from a & e .
the north norfolk mp says the situation will get worse in years to come , as services struggle to keep up with rising demand .
mr lamb says the government has a responsibility to act when pressure on hospitals begin to affect patient safety .
`` health and social care services urgently need a cash injection to help free up beds and prevent this crisis from worsening , '' he said .
`` there 's no time to waste in setting aside party differences and working together to secure the long-term future of the nhs and social care . ''

documents.title: restaurant targetted in ram raid
text: thousands of pounds worth of damage has been caused to a restaurant near norwich following a ram raid .
police said a red tata flatbed van was driven into the clocktower in bowthorpe at around 03:00 on tuesday , damaging the wall and internal fittings .
nothing was stolen .
norfolk police believes the van was stolen from lavengro road between 00:30 and 03:00 .
anyone who witnessed the incident , or may have information , is asked to contact either the police or crimestoppers .

documents.title: advice for community following fatal fire
text: fire and police teams will this weekend be offering advice to residents in an area of norwich where a man died in a house fire yesterday morning .
emergency services were called to penn grove , near aylsham road , shortly before 02:00 .
the building was well alight , and a man was trapped inside .
despite treatment by paramedics , he died at the scene .
we have safety advice on our website- watch the video & perform a safety check on your house , in about 5 minutes !
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

text: drivers urged to take extra care in icy conditions - the front page of today 's eastern daily press :

text: mini break has the desired effect for city midfielder - the back page of the eastern daily press today :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: gorleston hoping for bumper fa vase crowd
text: norfolk 's last remaining club in the fa vase will target a place in the last 16 of the competition this weekend .
gorleston , who are unbeaten in the thurlow nunn league this season , host coleshill town from the midlands in the fourth round tomorrow afternoon .
gorleston chairman alan gordon told me : `` everyone at the club is right up for it .
we 've got a team that we 've never played before and hope we have a big crowd to support us on saturday . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: canaries chase two fa cup wins
text: norwich city will attempt to complete an fa cup double this weekend .
premier league southampton come to carrow road tomorrow on third-round day .
before that , the canaries ' under-18s go to burnley this evening in the fourth round of the fa youth cup .
norwich won the competition in 2013 and have already beaten watford 5-1 this season .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: coastal management 'an ongoing process '
text: the mundesley coast management scheme is in the outline stage , and a public event later this month will give local residents an opportunity to find out more about what it means for the community .

councillor angie fitch-tillett , of north norfolk district council , says coastal management is an `` ongoing process and the mundesley scheme has been included in the environment agency 's six-year programme , and this is the next step in the process '' .
the council spends around £ 310,000 each year to maintain 21 miles of coastline - that 's £ 14,700 a mile .

`` on top of this , our defences do require more substantial investment and in order to do this we have to put an additional £ 300,000 of district council funding towards this scheme to help secure further government funds , '' ms fitch-tillett said .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: plans to protect coastal community from the sea
text: plans to protect a north norfolk village from the sea are to be go on public display .
the mundesley coast management scheme could cost up to £ 1.5m , and an outline business case is being developed to attract funding and gain approval for the work .
a public drop-in session is being held in the village 's coronation hall on tuesday , 17 january .
the event , between 14:00 and 19:30 , will provide information on how coastal management schemes are funded , and what the next steps will be .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: it 's icy out there allow extra time for your journey
text: motorists are warned to be careful on the roads , following a heavy frost overnight .
temperatures dropped below freezing in many parts of the county , and the gritters were out twice .
yesterday , norfolk police dealt with more than 70 collisions within a few hours , many of them due to the icy conditions .
it 's not just the roads the pavements are slippery too .
the roads are # frozen again .

text: hello and thanks for joining us for friday 's norfolk live .
we 're here throughout the day , keeping you up to date with what 's happening across the county .
it 's frosty and chilly start to the day , with patches of freezing fog police are advising motorists to drive with care .
elizabeth rizzini 's forecast follows shortly .

documents.title: our live coverage today
text: it 's goodbye from the norfolk live team for the day .
we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye on the page , because if a major story breaks you 'll find the details here .
here 's a quick recap of some of the stories we 've brought you today :
if there 's anything happening in your part of the county that you think we should know about , you can get in touch with us on email , facebook or send a tweet .

documents.title: weather : cold and foggy overnight
text: there 's a chance of an isolated shower near the coast , but otherwise it 'll stay dry but damp in places across the bbc east region .
there will be a widespread frost with mist and freezing fog patches overnight as the temperature dips to a minimum of -2c ( 28f ) , but it will be warmer towards the coast .
friday will see freezing fog gradually lifting , although it may linger throughout the morning .
some bright spells developing , but turning cloudier through the day with the chance of patchy rain later and high of 4-6c ( 39-43f ) .
there are more details for where you are on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: norwich city sign icelandic youngster
text: norwich city have made their first signing of the january transfer window .
sixteen-year-old midfielder agust hlynsson joins for an undisclosed fee from breidablik .
city 's under-18s manager david wright has told bbc radio norfolk that hlynsson will go straight into the squad to face burnley in the fa youth cup tomorrow night .
city complete deal for 16-year-old icelandic midfielder agust hlynsson .

documents.title: icy conditions make for a 'challenging day ' on the roads
text: norfolk 's police were kept busy this morning as the first real cold snap of the winter led to dozens of collisions on the county 's roads .

insp jonathan chapman said weather conditions made it a `` challenging day '' , as officers dealt with more than 70 incidents within a few hours - including several on the a140 scole bypass , which led to the road being closed southbound for some hours .
he advises motorists to allow more time for journeys , and to `` expect the unexpected '' as driving conditions can change at this time of the year .
with temperatures expected to drop below freezing tonight , norfolk 's gritters will be out and about on the main roads this evening and again early tomorrow morning .
gritting on all county gritting routes this evening , with a further run at 3am in the west , south and inland north zones # norfolkwinter
could i ask what area is classed as inland zones ?
hi shaun , i do n't have a precise answer to hand but there are six gritting zones in norfolk - south , west , norwich , inland
does that include school roads .
hi brian , you can find out which roads are gritted here : i can tell you all a and b roads are gritted .
thanks to all the gritter drivers who are turning out to kerp us safe .

documents.title: worker taken to hospital after industrial incident
text: a man has been taken to hospital after an industrial incident at a printing works in great yarmouth .
emergency services were called to downey and co on the conge shortly after 15:30 , and the man was taken to the james paget university hospital with hand injuries .
police tell me his condition is not life-threatening .

a representative of downey 's told me he could n't comment or confirm any details , but a mechanic at a nearby business told me he was asked for a crowbar , having been told a worker had suffered a crush injury on a printing press .
norfolk police said the health and safety executive had been informed .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: abusers 'should not cross-examine ' victims
text: abusers 'should not cross-examine ' victims

documents.title: flood warnings lifted
text: flood warnings for parts of norwich and the broads are no longer in force .
the environment agency has lifted the warnings for the tidal rivers yare and waveney , and for the lower wensum including norwich .
the earlier high river levels in norwich allowed a perfect reflection of pulls ferry in the river wensum , as captured by bbc weather watcher ashby rob .

documents.title: is your pooch a porker ?
text: as we start the new year , many of us will be trying to shed a few of those excess pounds gained over the christmas season .
but has your pet pooch been piling on the pounds ?
a survey by the pets at home chain has shown that swaffham is one of the top 10 places in the uk for fat dogs with 41 % overweight , compared to just over a quarter in norwich .
the average for the uk is 22 % .
vet chris tomlinson said one in four of the dogs he saw at his north walsham practice was overweight .

`` occasionally there is a medical condition where the dog has an over-active thyroid but that 's an exception principally the dog is eating too much food for the amount of exercise it 's doing , '' he said .
it 's quite simple you lose weight by eating less leave less food in the dog bowl . ''

documents.title: battling to control bird flu
text: a farmer in west norfolk claims that not everyone is following the rules to limit the spread of bird flu .
last month , the department for environment , food and rural affairs ( defra ) announced a ban on keeping poultry in the open , which has now been extended until 28 february .
karen field , who farms 200 birds at power poultry and pork , near king 's lynn , says it 's been hard work , and not everyone is following the rules .

we 're fighting a battle whenever we get high winds everything blows off and you 're fighting to keep it down but the biggest problem is people not covering their birds , they 're not bothered , they do n't think it affects them . ''

documents.title: hunstanton churches open new cap debt centre
text: people struggling with debt in hunstanton and the surrounding villages of north west norfolk will now be able to access free help from the town 's new debt centre hosted by union church in partnership with christians against poverty .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: watch : it 's counting time at the zoo
text: they 're counting the animals not two by two .
the annual animal stocktake is underway at banham zoo and africa alive

documents.title: trailers and jcb stolen from builder 's yard
text: thieves have stolen four trailers and a jcb from a builder 's yard in emneth .
the yard , on lady 's drove , was broken into some time between 17:30 on tuesday , 3 january and 06:30 yesterday .
the following items were taken .
police are asking anyone who saw sus activity , or who has information , to contact them or crimestoppers .

documents.title: watch : lost seal returned to the sea
text: a seal who decided to head inland on new year 's eve has been returned to the sea .
it 's believed he swam inland along the river glaven , before being spotted in the garden of a holiday home in blakeney .
after being checked over by the rspca , the grey seal was returned to the sea on new year 's day .

text: emergency services have been called to a number of incidents this morning , many of which occurred in icy conditions .
norfolk police have been urging motorists to drive safely advice that went unheeded by one motorist caught 'doing a tonne ' near the thickthorn roundabout .

documents.title: watch : woman plans first haircut for 33 years
text: at 55ins ( 1.4m ) long , elaine mayes ' hair is her crowning glory .
it has n't been cut since 1994 but now she has decided to have it chopped for charity .
for every £ 1 donated , her hair will get shorter by the millimetre .
elaine , who lives in bacton and works in aberdeen , is hoping to raise at least £ 1,400 for cancer research uk .

documents.title: broken boilers mean no lessons for pupils
text: no school today for pupils of methwold primary - a broken boiler has left the school very cold .
a new part is on its way , so fingers crossed for tomorrow
and it 's an early end to the school day for pupils of the rudham church of england primary academy .
it also has a broken boiler , so will be closing at 13:00 .

documents.title: magdalen shootings : photos from the scene
text: the west norfolk village of magdalen lies to the west of the river great ouse , eight miles ( 12km ) south of king 's lynn .
there was a sense of shock in the village after the bodies of allison and stephen muncaster were found at their home in stow road , in the early hours on 12 july last year .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: magdalen shootings : timeline of events
text: norfolk coroner 's court heard cctv cameras both inside and outside the home of allison muncaster recorded the moments that led to her death on 12 july , 2016 .
she was discovered dead in her home from gunshot wounds , and the body of her husband stephen was discovered in the front garden .
det con jeremy pitt gave the following timeline to the inquest in norwich this morning :
mrs muncaster was on the sofa and her husband produced a gun , and took aim .
she got off the sofa and tried to run but he fired the gun , fatally wounding her .
he then left with the shotgun .
there were no previous reports of domestic violence , and mr muncaster had a valid shotgun licence .
the coroner , jacqueline lake , said there was `` no lawful reason '' why 48-year-old mrs muncaster was killed .
author: Alex Dunlop
BBC Look East

documents.title: shooting of wife captured on cctv
text: an inquest into the death of allison muncaster , found dead at her home from shotgun wounds , heard the shooting by her husband stephen was captured on cctv inside the house .
mrs muncaster , 48 , was found dead in the lounge of the property in magdalen , near king 's lynn , on 12 july , 2016 .
she had a gunshot entry to her right cheek .
post-mortem examinations showed no sign of alcohol or drugs in her system .
det con jeremy pitt told the inquest , at norfolk coroner 's court today , that mrs muncaster was found dead at 12:10 .
the body of mr muncaster , 47 , was discovered in the front garden with a gun by his side .
author: Alex Dunlop
BBC Look East

documents.title: magdalen deaths : woman 'unlawfully killed '
text: a verdict of unlawful killing has been reached into the death of allison muncaster , who was found dead at her home at magdalen , near king 's lynn , in july last year .
an inquest at norfolk coroner 's court heard that mrs muncaster , 48 , died from shotgun wounds to her head .
she was discovered inside her home on stow road , magdalen , on 12 july .
the body of mrs muncaster 's husband , stephen , 47 , was found with shotgun injuries in the front garden .
an inquest into his death will be heard at a later date .
police said they were not looking for anyone else in connection with the deaths .
the couple were relatives of the lottery winner michael carroll .
author: Alex Dunlop
BBC Look East

documents.title: breaking'unlawful killing ' verdict into death of woman
text: an inquest has returned a verdict of unlawful killing into the death of allison muncaster , found dead at her home in magdalen , near king 's lynn , in july 2016 .

documents.title: ice : allow extra time for your journeys
text: it 's as cold as ice out there and emergency services are dealing with a number of incidents across the county .
please allow extra time for journeys , we 've already been to 2 x rtc 's in the # fakenham area that were caused by black ice # drivetoarrive
# drivetoarrive - the roads are really icy in places , do n't be taken by surprise , drive carefully .

documents.title: investigation launched into cause of fatal house fire
text: an investigation has been launched into a fatal house fire in norwich earlier today .
emergency services were called to penn grove , off aylsham road , shortly before 02:00 .
a person found inside the property was treated by paramedics , but was pronounced dead at the scene .
the death is being treated as unexplained and the cause of the fire is unknown .
the property has been sealed off .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: be prepared for possible flooding
text: flood alerts are in place for parts of norwich and the broads as water levels remain high following high tides .
the environment agency warns of a risk to flooding to riverside properties along the lower wensum .
in the new mills sluice area of norwich .
a flood alert is in place for the rivers yare and waveney following yesterday 's tidal surge .

documents.title: take care on the roads it 's icy out there
text: there are icy road conditions across the county this morning .
norfolk police are dealing with a number of incidents .
the a140 is closed southbound , between dickleburgh and scole .
road closure - a140 southbound , btw dickleburgh and scole - dangerously icey road - highways aware & on route to grit - police on scene # ccr

sorry and stay safe
before you set off you must be able to see , so clear all ice from all your windows .
have u seen some people , its crazy !
i know they clear a tiny bit of the windscreen and it 's ok
or reverse everywhere as the rear demister works quicker and saves the scrape .

@ twitterid it 's not just the ice , but water , condensation and fogged up windscreen and windows need to be clear

documents.title: if you think it 's chilly today
text: do you remember the `` big freeze '' of 1963 ?
it was the coldest winter for more than 200 years , with temperatures so cold that even the sea froze in places .
a reminder of the # big freeze of '63 when the sea froze !
here 's a vessel frozen-in on the river yare , 15 miles from the sea in january # tbt

documents.title: person dies in house fire
text: a person has died after a house fire in norwich earlier this morning .
more than 20 firefighters tackled the blaze , which broke out in a property on penn grove , off aylsham road , at 01:45 .
norfolk fire and rescue spokesman gary collins said the fire was `` severe and well developed '' by the time firefighters arrived at the scene .
they used breathing apparatus to rescue one person from the building .
an investigation into the cause of the fire is under way .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thursday 's weather : feeling cold despite sunshine later
text: after a chilly start , it 'll be a bright and generally dry day , with plenty of sunshine around .
winds will stay fairly light , with a top temperature of about 5c ( 41f ) .
if you 're out and about early on , do n't forget the met office has a yellow warning of ice in place until 10:00 .
watch my full regional forecast here :
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to norfolk live
text: hello and thanks for joining us for thursday 's norfolk live .
we 'll have the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates for you throughout the day .
take care on the roads this morning it 's icy out there and will remain chilly all day - elizabeth rizzini 's forecast follows shortly .
if you 've a story , or a photo , that you 'd like to share with us , you can get in touch in the usual way , send an email or a tweet , or via facebook .
it 's as cold as ice , are you willing to sacrifice ?

author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: it 's goodbye for now from the norfolk live team for wednesday .

we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow to bring you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather - but keep an eye on this page overnight because any breaking news stories affecting the county will appear here .
thank you to the people of cantley who welcomed me to their village this afternoon , where i monitored the rising flood waters with them following a tidal surge .
you can find out how that went by scrolling down to see their story - and also find out more about these :
finally , if you 've got a story or photo you 'd like to share with us , you can get in touch in the usual way , send an email or a tweet , or via facebook .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: drivers given 'one hour blue-light training ' by private ambulance firm
text: former drivers for a private ambulance firm that provides emergency cover for the east of england ambulance service trust ( eeast ) , including a small number of jobs in norfolk , claim they were given just an hour 's training to drive under blue lights .
the drivers used to work for a firm called private ambulance service ( pas ) which is contracted to respond to emergencies on behalf of eeast during busy times .
a spokesman for eeast has confirmed the private service was used as cover in norfolk 43 times in 2015/16 out of a total of 13,000 call outs .
but the pas has told the bbc 's victoria derbyshire programme it does n't accept the allegations .
`` all of our staff are fully trained above the required standard , and we have full policies and procedures in place to deal with any eventuality within the business , '' said the spokesman .
the cqc said it had carried out an inspection at the pas in august , following concerns raised by former pas staff members , and had found `` many of the concerns unsubstantiated '' .
however , it also said it had found poor standards in infection control , staff not being given enough time off between shifts and poor governance and leadership arrangements .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: weather : dry this evening with long clear spells
text: staying mainly dry this evening with long clear spells but a risk of a few showers blowing in from the north sea which may have a fleeting wintry flavour .
feeling cold in the breeze overnight and a sharp frost will develop bringing a risk of ice .
thursday will start cold but long spells of sunshine are expected although showers are possible across northern and eastern counties .
maximum temperature : 6c ( 40f ) .
more details from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: butterfield appeal rejected
text: derby county have had their appeal rejected against the red card jacob butterfield received at carrow road on monday .
former canary butterfield was sent off for a challenge on city forward wes hoolahan .
the football association has announced that the three-match ban will be upheld following an investigation by a independent regulatory commission .
in his post-match press conference rams manager steve mclaren said : `` i question if it was even a foul ''
norwich won the match 3-0

author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: council rejects plans for self-build home
text: earlier we told you about a couple who wanted to build their dream home .
paul and victoria frost want to leave social housing and build a house on a plot on the edge of the village of chedgrave .
but south norfolk council 's planning committee today voted by eight to one to turn down permission because the site for the house is outside the local development boundary .

but mr frost says planners used maps that were 20 years out of date to make their case against his application and also failed to include photos of a development of houses directly opposite his plot .
`` we 're very disappointed .
we thought we had a good chance of getting this through , '' said mr frost , who also had the support of his local mp , richard bacon .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: dippy the dinosaur being flat packed for tour
text: a six-person team is expected to take three-and-a-half weeks dismantling one of the uk 's most famous dinosaur skeletons from thursday .
dippy the diplodocus , a 70ft long ( 21.3m ) plaster-cast sauropod replica made up of 292 bones , is set to leave the natural history museum in london later this year .

the replica will not go into storage but instead go on a national tour , but you 'll have to wait until july 2020 to see the skeleton in norfolk when it will be on display in the nave of norwich cathedral .

documents.title: tidal surge retreats at great yarmouth
text: the environment agency 's red flood alert issued earlier today also affected parts of great yarmouth .
this was the scene on the beach at south denes as the waters receded .
thankfully , the agency now believes the worst is over .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: river yare tidal surge : keeping an eye on the boats
text: as i left the pub i met boat owner steve millbanks .
he 'd pulled on his waders and was trying to make sure his cruiser did n't get silted in as a result of the rising water level .
for all the latest updates on flood warnings in norfolk , keep an eye on the environment agency website , which should be updated tonight or first thing tomorrow .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: river yare tidal surge : pub landlady remains alert
text: before heading back to base , i nipped in to the reedcutter to get landlady lyn millbanks 's reaction to the environment agency saying the red flood warning for cantley was due to be lifted .
`` water is still seeping through the bank [ protecting her pub ] and we 've still got high tide for another quarter of a hour or so , '' she said .
`` until the water drops below the level of the path , we 'll stay on alert for the next three-and-a-half hours . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: river yare tidal surge : residents pleased it 's over
text: barbara griffin was a bit concerned when she heard about the red flood warning because she 's lives so close to the river .
in all the years she 's lived in cantley , she 's only be flooded once - when the river burst its banks .
she told me the marshes behind her house `` never usually comes up this far '' ( as you can see below ) - and with the waters receding she can now rest easy .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: breakingriver yare tidal surge : environment agency says the worst is over
text: there 's good news for people in cantley - the environment agency has just told us the flood surge has reached its peak and should start receding in the next 30 to 45 minutes .
the agency will update its website and hopes to have withdrawn the red flood warning by tomorrow morning .
a relief to pub landlady lyn and her regulars
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: river yare tidal surge : footpath seven inches under water
text: so , it 's about an hour to go before the expected high tide hits cantley .
i 've nipped down to the river - and you can see the water has completely covered the footpath .
this is the closest i could get - the footpath is about seven inches ( 17cm ) under water .
we 've got a call out to the environment agency to see if it has a more exact time for when the tidal surge could hit .

documents.title: river yare tidal surge : water rises three inches in 30 minutes
text: i 've been here for just 30 minutes and the water has continued to rise .
it 's lapping the pontoon steps now and the bottom step which leads up to the reedcutter .
that means it 's risen three inches ( 7.6cm ) since i got here .
i 'm heading off now to see what arrangements those householders might be making for the expected flood surge .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: river yare tidal surge : pub is close to the river
text: this below shows just how close the reedcutter is to the river yare - with the tops of cruisers appearing above the level of the bank .
most of cantley 's houses are about 150 yards ( 137m ) from the river , with only a handful as close as the pub .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: river yare tidal surge : sandbags ready 'if it starts to get worse '
text: the rushcutter 's landlady lyn millbanks said the main problem was excess water seepage through the banks - it is beginning to creep through .
`` we 'll get out the sandbags if it starts to get worse '' , she added
as you can see below , the pub 's garden is beginning to look a bit soggy
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: extra beds put in place at hospital 'full up ' after christmas demand
text: additional beds have been put in place at a hospital serving east norfolk and north suffolk after high levels of demand over christmas and new year .
all beds are full at the james paget university hospital in gorleston .
a spokesman said : `` this situation is not unique to the trust at this time ; other trusts across the country have also been dealing with pressures on their beds . ''
christine allen , chief executive , said : `` we are focusing on enabling discharges for those patients that are medically stable and fit for discharge .
`` junior doctors are being asked to work extra hours if they can and some clinics are being cancelled from thursday 5 january to free up as many senior medical staff as possible .
`` patients that attend a & e are likely to have a long wait . ''

the hospital is advising patients to visit pharmacies which can provide `` confidential , expert advice and treatment for a range of common illnesses and complaints '' without the need for a gp appointment .
the nhs111 service is advised for urgent cases but not emergencies .
the trust says gps offer a `` fast '' service and surgeries have trained professionals who can advise patients .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: river yare tidal surge : water level 'higher than normal '
text: the landlady of the reedcutter in cantley says she 's not that worried about flooding at the moment - despite the water level outside her pub being higher than normal .

lyn millbanks says she has n't taken any special precautions , such as removing furniture from the ground floor , as she expects the steep bank protecting the river to take up most of the excess water in the expected flood surge .
the environment agency has issued a red flood warning for areas of the norfolk broads around cantley , brundall , reedham and great yarmouth .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: river yare tidal surge : waters begin to rise
text: i 've arrived in cantley , one of a number of areas in the norfolk broads for which the environment agency has issued a red flood warning .
the towpath has been flooded , as you can see from this below .
we were initially told the expected flood surge would happen at 13:30 - but i 'm now hearing it may be nearer 16:30 instead .
i 'm asking for an update on this .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: river yare tidal surge : red means danger
text: the red areas on this map are those at risk of flooding this lunchtime due to a tidal surge on the river yare ,
for more information , visit the environment agency website .
we have a reporter on the way to the area and we 'll let you know the latest situation .

documents.title: high tides and storm surges behind latest flood warning
text: more now on why the river yare is at risk of flooding today .

the environment agency says areas of the norfolk broads around cantley , brundall , reedham and great yarmouth have all been issued with a red flood warning , meaning there 's a risk to property and people .
trevor bond from the agency says an amber flood alert has been issued for the rest of the river yare .
it 's been caused by a storm over the north sea blowing strong winds on shore , stopping the high tide flowing back down the river system to sea .
`` we have this phenomenon because of tide locking , where water running down from the rivers is unable to get out to sea because of the water pushing inwards from the sea , '' he said .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: derby appeal against butterfield red
text: derby county have announced that they will appeal against the red card jacob butterfield received at carrow road on monday .
former canaries player butterfield was sent off for a challenge on city forward wes hoolahan .
in his post-match press conference rams manager steve mclaren said : `` i question if it was even a foul . ''
norwich won the match 3-0 .

documents.title: hand grenade found in watton
text: police have been called to deal with a hand grenade discovered at an address in watton .

documents.title: river yare on red flood warning
text: the river yare to the east of norwich is at risk of flooding , according to the environment agency .
a storm surge in the north sea combined with high tides has led to high water levels in the south of the broads , which are due to peak at lunchtime .
the agency website says : `` we are expecting high water levels in the broads due to tide locking caused by a storm surge along the east coast . ''
a flood warning is now in force for `` riverside properties along the tidal river yare including cantley , brundall and reedham '' .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: mp supports small developments for locals
text: there are calls for a relaxation of village boundaries so more people can build their own homes .
they come as a couple in chedgrave who want to leave their housing association home to self-build on a plot across the road wait to hear if they will be granted planning permission
their local mp , conservative richard bacon , said cases like theirs were very different to allowing developers to build several homes , and that the rules should be more flexible .

`` i talk to parish council chairs who say 'we do not want 150 homes ( from large developers ) but we would like six or seven houses in our area for our own local people and there are provisions within the legislation for local councils to put in stipulations about having a local connection , and i think that 's exactly where we should be going . ''
south norfolk council is due to make a decision on the frosts ' application later today .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: couple say council 'unfair ' over planned house
text: a couple are due to find out today if they have been granted permission to build their own home .

paul and victoria frost from chedgrave , near loddon , who want to leave their housing association home and build their own on a site in the village , say south norfolk council is treating them 'unfairly ' .
the site is outside the local development area and the application is recommended to be refused by councillors today .
mr frost said his proposed site was opposite a development of houses where the build-line had been altered .
the council planning document says there 's no need for further housing in the area , recommending refusal on the grounds of : `` harm to countryside - not sustainable development '' .
a decision on the application is expected later this morning .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: nearly 1,500 now backing 'hands off ' mobiles campaign
text: nearly 1,500 people are already supporting bbc radio norfolk and suffolk 's `` hands off '' campaign to stop drivers using mobile phones at the wheel .
the `` hands off '' message is also being made into car stickers as well as appearing on matrix road signs .
suffolk county councillor james finch , who is responsible for roads and transport , said he had written to highways england asking it to put the messages on signs under its jurisdiction
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: how do you count 1,000 hissing cockroaches ?
text: it 's that time of year when our zoos and wildlife parks are preparing to count the many species within their care .

keepers are n't just expected to clean out and feed a wide variety of animals from snails to rhinos , they also record information about their movements between zoo collections and their health and behaviour .
banham zoo says this information is used to provide data to the coordinators of managed breeding programmes .
of course , some animals are easier to count than others .
cheetahs are quite easy to spot ( excuse the pun ) - but counting about 1,000 madagascar hissing cockroaches can be quite tricky , says the zoo .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: fraud policeman 'would find jail tough '
text: a lawyer acting for a former norfolk officer who conned business associates and the taxman out of £ 1m has argued that prison would be harder for him than others .
ben staff , 35 , is beginning a four-and-a-half-year sentence after being found guilty of fraud yesterday at norwich crown court .
staff , who resigned from the force in 2008 , used his connections to gain his victims ' trust , spending the money on his lavish lifestyle .
at his sentencing yesterday , his barrister amiot vollenweider argued that as a former police officer , staff would find prison tougher than others .
but judge mark dennis replied that `` a former policeman should have known better '' .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: magistrates 'proving hard to recruit '
text: magistrates in norfolk say they are finding it hard to recruit new members for the bench .
dick meadows , deputy chair of norfolk magistrates ' bench , says it is looking for more young people , but that there are obstacles .
`` we have a couple of magistrates in their 20s , more in their 30s and 40s and a larger number in their 50s and 60s , '' he said .
`` the bigger problem for us is how do we encourage employers in norfolk to actually allow people to take time off to become magistrates ?
that 's becoming more difficult .

`` the irony is there 's a premium here for employers because magistrates , when they 're trained , acquire a lot of transferable skills , difficult decision-making , leadership qualities and working under pressure . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: canaries must sell before they buy
text: norwich city will have to sell before they buy in this month 's transfer window .

the canaries have been `` working since summer '' to ensure they recruit well before the end of january , but according to boss alex neil they will not be able to do so without offloading players first .
neil says `` the ramifications '' of city 's relegation from the premier league last year has affected the club 's transfer policy .
norwich will receive more than £ 60m in parachute payments over this and the next three seasons .
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: weather : mostly dry and cloudy with some sunshine later
text: becoming mostly cloudy through the morning with a little patchy rain .
this will clear during the afternoon with some sunshine breaking through but it 'll feel cold .
temperatures will fall quickly during the evening with frost forming .
maximum temperature : 7c ( 45f )
more from bbc weather :
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : accident at a47 burlingham
text: an accident in north burlingham at the b1140 south walsham road is causing problems .
traffic is affected in both directions .
travel will have more details .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to norfolk live
text: hello and good morning from the team .
stick with us as we bring you all the county 's important stories , sport , travel and weather as they happen .
our main story so far , employers in norfolk are making it hard to recruit new magistrates , according to the local bench..
it says it needs more young people but too many firms refuse to allow the time off needed .
and some 4,000 animals are being counted in norfolk today as banham zoo says the annual stock count can throw up some surprises .
weather is next but thanks to our weather watcher for the of what it looked like a short while ago in stiffkey .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: ex-police officer jailed for £ 1m fraud
text: ex-police officer jailed for £ 1m fraud

documents.title: our live coverage today :
text: our regular updates have now ended for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on wednesday .
you can scroll down to take a look at the stories we 've brought you today , but here 's a quick recap of some of them :
if you 've got a story , or maybe a photo , that you 'd like to share with us , you can get in touch in the usual way , send an email or a tweet , or via facebook .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy and dry overnight
text: it 'll be slightly warmer than last night with cloudy skies , but on the whole a mainly dry night across the bbc east region , with some clear intervals .
temperatures staying above freezing at 2c ( 36f ) .
wednesday will start cloudy with the risk of light rain or drizzle moving in from the north but drier and brighter later with sunny spells and a top temperature of 6c , 43f .
weather has more local details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: a cloudy and cool end to the day
text: there 's not been much chance of seeing blue skies over norfolk today , as this selection of your photos shows .
click here to find out how you too can be a bbc weather watcher .

documents.title: average speed cameras to go 'live ' on dangerous a road
text: average speed safety cameras which have been recently installed on one of the county 's most dangerous roads are to be switched on from next week .
the camera system , on the a17 to the west of king 's lynn , will be `` live '' from monday , 9 january , to capture speeding motorists .
the stretch of road has double the national average for casualties on rural class a roads .
the high accident severity is indicative of high traffic speeds .
35 % of these casualties are motorcyclists and the new cameras are designed to capture both motor vehicles and motor cyclists . ''

documents.title: former police officer sentenced for £ 1m fraud
text: a former norfolk police officer has been jailed after conning business associates and the taxman out of more than £ 1m .
ben staff , of lucas court , norwich , used his reputation as an ex-policeman to gain the trust of his victims before using the money intended for business accounts to fund his lavish lifestyle .
staff , 35 , resigned from norfolk constabulary in 2008 .
an investigation into his conduct was launched in 2012 after the force received a complaint about his business practice .
he was arrested in 2014 .
in march 2016 , he was convicted of six charges at king 's lynn crown court .
a second trial at norwich crown court in december found him guilty of two charges .
he was jailed today at norwich crown court for four years and six months .

documents.title: breakingjail term for former norfolk police officer
text: a former officer with norfolk constabulary has been jailed for fraud offences totalling more than £ 1m .
we 'll bring you more on this shortly

documents.title: duchess of cambridge honoured for her photography enthusiasm
text: the duchess of cambridge has been given lifetime honorary membership of the royal photographic society ( rps ) .

she was the first member of the royal family to take the first official photographs of a royal baby , when she released of her newborn daughter princess charlotte being cradled by prince george at anmer hall , their family home on the sandringham estate in west norfolk .
the duchess has also released marking milestones in her children 's lives , including prince george 's first day at nursery school and princess charlotte 's first birthday .
kate is the latest royal to be associated with the educational charity , which promotes photography and supports photographers .
queen victoria and prince albert were early patrons of the rps , which was founded in 1853 .

documents.title: brexit : six months on , the views of residents in great yarmouth
text: in june 2016 , six out of 10 residents across norfolk voted for the uk to leave the european union .
six months on , the bbc one victoria derbyshire programme has been to great yarmouth to see how the people feel about brexit now .
here 's what some of them told reporter mike cowan :
i just went with the flow i know it 's wrong and i regret doing that because i still do n't understand what i voted 'no ' for . ''
asked whether she was bothered that mps might get a say on triggering article 50 , this voter gave her response :
if it 's how we do it , fair enough if it 's whether we do it or not they should have no say whatsover - the public have spoken '' .
members of this knitting group say we should be able to vote on the terms of brexit .
they 're not being open they 're a closed cabinet - so we do n't know what 's propaganda and what 's true '' .
asked whether she was still optimistic about brexit , this market trader says she does n't have `` as much faith in it as she did previously '' :
obviously i voted out , but i think things are slipping a little bit they 're moving the goal posts further away and i do n't think we 'll truly be out and there 'll be a lot of upset people . ''
you can watch the full interview here .

documents.title: protest against rail fare increase
text: protests have been taking place at railway stations across the country following the latest annual fares increase .
ticket prices are going up by an average of 2.3 % .
this was the scene at norwich railway station a short while ago .

the protestors told me that the increases are `` painful '' for regular commuters , and that they 'd prefer rail travel to be a litte bit cheaper , as `` services in this country are n't up to scratch compared with the german and french '' .
author: Wally Webb
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: lead thieves target churches
text: two norfolk churches are the latest to become the victims of lead theft .
sometime between 17:00 on wednesday , 21 december and 09:00 the following morning , a large quantity of lead was taken from the roof of st margaret 's church in toft monks near loddon .
in a separate incident , thieves took lead from the roof of st bartholomew 's church in sloley , near north walsham , between 16:00 on thursday , 29 december and 09:00 on friday , 30 december .
anyone with information is asked to contact norfolk police , or crimestoppers anonymously .

documents.title: for the love of william

author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: now let 's build on this says city boss
text: canaries turn on style to show just what they are capable of - today 's back page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: city road closed to traffic
text: another road in norwich has closed to traffic as part of plans to pedestrianise the city .
all saints street and parts of all saints green will only be open to walkers and cyclists .
traffic from cattle market street and golden ball street will have to leave the city along ber street .
it 's the final stage of improvements to the area under the transport for norwich scheme , and is expected to be completed in time for easter .

county councilor martin wilby , chair of the transport committee , says the idea is to make this part of the city safer for pedestrians and cyclists , and to attract more footfall to businesses in the area .
bus companies will up or drop off passengers from outside the john lewis department store on ber street , where disabled parking will also be available .
it 's not the only transport scheme starting this week in norwich - improvements to cycle connections begin tomorrow on the newmarket road cycle path .

documents.title: action to protect saltwater fish from tidal surge
text: last week we told you how the environment agency had protected more than 100,000 freshwater fish on the broads over christmas .
the herbert woods boatyard in potter heigham is a refuge for the fish over the winter , and a surge tide can push saltwater into the yard .
a special barrier has been installed to protect the fish .
this afternoon that barrier will be raised until salt levels in the river thurne have dropped .
1/2 to protect fish we will raise the barrier at potter heigham at 14.30 today ahead of salt water & surge tides

documents.title: oliveira is loving life at city
text: hat-trick lifts striker 's spirits even higher - the back page of today 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: tourism set for 2017 boom
text: industry bosses predict a strong year ahead for east anglia - the front page of the eastern daily press today :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: the suffering caused when using a mobile at the wheel - a mother 's story
text: one of those who wants drivers to turn off their mobiles when they 're at the wheel is west norfolk mum alice husband .
her seven-year-old son seth ( died after he was hit by a car while crossing a road in tydd st mary in december 2014 .
the driver was on a hands-free call .
seth was taken to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge and died two weeks later from his injuries .
radio norfolk has launched the `` hands off '' campaign to get motorists to leave their phones alone when they 're driving .
alice told me why she wants to get all mobile phone use by drivers banned by law , including hands-free kit .
`` i 'd sent seth across the road to put something in the post box .
on the way back he was hit by a car .
`` the driver was saying to me 'it was an accident , an accident i did n't see him ' .
`` the woman driver did n't know that making phone calls hands-free would distract her from driving , the research was n't out there .
it was only at the inquest that everybody was saying new research shows it 's the conversation that 's the problem .
`` she was n't speeding , she 's a mother herself and she understands the impact of what happened that day .
she was still distraught at the inquest a year and a half later . ''
ms husband has had thousands of signatures to an online petition for mobile phone use by drivers to be banned by law , but could n't raise enough to get the issue debated in parliament .

it 's not about my suffering everybody 's suffering and i feel it 's important to prevent that from happening again , to try and help drivers become safer on the road so there 's a chance other people 's lives are saved . ''
author: Jill Bennett
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: the fa people 's cup is back - sign up now ! # peoplescup
text: looking for a new project for the start of 2017 ?
how about getting fit/fitter with a chance to win free tickets to the fa cup final ?

get inspired has again teamed up with the football association to launch the 2017 fa people 's cup , a free knockout competition that will give the people of england the chance to play in their version of the fa cup .
from sunday league regulars to folk who have only kicked a ball in their back yard everyone can take part .
find out more and sign up here .

documents.title: 'motorists should not multi-task '
text: `` we want to see it becoming as socially unacceptable as drink-driving '' - the words of ch insp kris barnard , of norfolk roads policing .
he was speaking on bbc radio norfolk about their `` hands off '' campaign - to stop drivers from using their phones at the wheel if they 're not hands-free .

he said they 're `` 100 % behind the campaign '' , and want everyone to come together to make it clear to friends , and for children to remind parents , that it 's not something that should be seen on the roads .
an offender faces a minimum of three penalty points on their licence and a fine of £ 100 , but this year that 's going to double to six points and £ 200 .
we 're getting better at detecting and pulling over motorists using their mobiles .
we 're inventive , using unmarked police bikes and high-sided trucks to catch people at speed .
offenders stand a good chance of being caught .
if you are driving you should be doing just that rather than trying to multi-task . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pressure eases on alex neil
text: norwich city 's emphatic 3-0 win against derby county last night silenced those calling for boss alex neil 's head .
nelson oliveira 's hat-trick meant city had four points from their last two games , with two clean sheets to boot .
prior to saturday 's goalless draw at brentford , the canaries had lost eight out of their last 10 league games .
however , fans at carrow road have only been vocal against neil in the past couple weeks .
the loss was derby 's heaviest of the season , and came on the back of a string of 10 unbeaten .
neil has now challenged his norwich side to perform like that every week .
now we 've got to maintain that level , that ca n't be a one-off .
that 's the difference between a top team and an average team .
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: campaign to stop drivers using mobile phones
text: `` put your phones away when you 're behind the wheel '' bbc radio norfolk is launching a campaign to get drivers off their mobile phones .
it 's called `` hands off '' , and has the backing of norfolk police .
in a crackdown in november , 140 drivers were caught in a week .

in just 45 minutes , ch insp kris barnard says about a dozen motorists were caught on the newmarket road heading towards norwich city centre , and he says some of those had children in their vehicles .
it 's a growing problem , with the number of offenders going up - 2,300 motorists in the county were caught in the last financial year compared to just over 800 the previous year .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ill passenger and engineering works behind back-to-work rail delays
text: there have been a number of rail delays on the main line from norwich to london this morning
it 's the first day since christmas eve when trains were due to run normally after bus replacement services were used to provide cover while engineering works were taking place .
greater anglia says over-running engineering works at shenfield were to blame for some delays and cancellations into liverpool street , but services are now returning to normal .
c2c is accepting greater anglia tickets between southend and fenchurch street .
a passenger taken ill on the 06:50 train at stratford resulted in some lines being blocked and the train operator is saying passengers should expect disruption mid-morning .
we will keep you up to date of any further alterations .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: mcclaren unhappy with sending off for derby
text: a hat-trick from summer signing nelson oliveira gave norwich city a much needed 3-0 win last night against derby county .
the portuguese forward ( now has seven goals in the last seven games and has become one of the league 's in-form strikers .
oliveira scored one in the first half before derby 's former canary jacob butterfield received a red card for a lunge on wes hoolahan .
derby boss steve mcclaren said : `` i think the referee got it wrong and we will be looking at an appeal .
`` butterfield 's feet were not off the ground and he got a little bit of the ball .
he also caught the player as well and because of that he falls down .
shortly after , oliveira struck twice in two minutes to seal the deal for city .
norwich are now up to ninth in the championship .
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: travel : train delays and cancellations due to over-running engineering works
text: trains have been cancelled this morning and there are issues with some services from shenfield in essex due to christmas engineering works over-running :
08:00 colchester town to london liverpool street will be started from colchester ( 08:18 ) due to earlier over-running engineering works .
rs

adjust your driving like you do when you 're walking in the ice ; slower , more carefully , with smoother movements & with respect # drivetoarrive

haha i do n't adjust my walking when there 's ice i just walk over it and hope i do n't fall on my arse

documents.title: weather : sunny intervals but feeling cold in breeze
text: after a frosty start with some icy patches possible , a dry day with more cloud around than yesterday but it will feel cold in brisk breeze .
some sunny periods are also likely but it 'll feel cool - although not as cold as monday .
maximum temperature : 6c ( 43f )
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: hello from norfolk live
text: a happy new year from all of the team at norfolk live and it 's got off to a good start for norwich city .
a hat-trick from nelson oliveira secured them a 3-0 win against derby county , lifting them to ninth in the championship .
we 'll have more on this along with our regular news , travel and weather updates throughout the day .
it 's a frosty and chilly start to the morning , with a `` yellow warning '' from the met office of icy conditions on roads and pavements until mid-morning .
as for the rest of the day , georgina burnett 's forecast will appear here shortly .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live
